pull_requests.title: Increment failuresAfterMeaningfulProgress before retry
pull_requests.author: ywangd

commits.message:
Increment failuresAfterMeaningfulProgress before retry

The count for failuresAfterMeaningfulProgress should be incremented
before testing whether to retry s3 blob read. In addition, it should not
be incremented on stream openning failures.

Resolves: #104436

comments.body: I'd be inclined to extract this as a private method rather than duplicate the expression, especially since inlining it like this loses the name that explains what it really means.
Makes sense. See 9d31e189677ffe358fcc3e69471cff3c4d48a741

pull_requests.body:
The count for failuresAfterMeaningfulProgress should be incremented before testing whether to retry s3 blob read. This is because we do not want to count failuresAfterMeaningfulProgress towards actual number of failures, i.e. we want to keep retrying if the last attempt has made meaningful progress. 
In addition, failuresAfterMeaningfulProgress should _not_ be incremented on stream openning failures.

Resolves: #104436

pull_requests.title: Added more information to the "deprecation" log for `skip: feature`
pull_requests.author: ldematte

commits.message: Added more information to the "deprecation" log for `skip: feature`

pull_requests.body:
The log we introduced in https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/104140 to warn about the deprecation of `skip: features` in favour of the less ambiguous `requires: test_runner_features` is not very useful on a test suite with many files and/or many tests (it just repeats the same message over and over again).

This PR changes the log to include the test name and the section location, so the info can be used to track down the exact place where to update the test.

For the reviewers: should I include other information, like the file name (or the test suite name)?
Or would it be better to keep the log message generic but include it just once per file/per test run?

pull_requests.title: Treat failed shard as no data in GetStatusActionIT
pull_requests.author: danielmitterdorfer

commits.message:
Treat failed shard as no data in GetStatusActionIT

Among other things, the profiling get status API checks whether a
cluster contains any profiling-related data. It uses the search API for
that internally since #103920. However, shards might not ready shortly
after index creation and consequently that search request will fail.

With this commit we check whether a search phase has failed and treat
this as if the cluster contains no profiling-related data.

Closes #104035
Reenable another test affected by this root cause

pull_requests.body:
Among other things, the profiling get status API checks whether a cluster contains any profiling-related data. It uses the search API for that internally since #103920. However, shards might not be ready shortly after index creation and consequently that search request will fail.

With this commit we check whether a search phase has failed and treat this as if the cluster contains no profiling-related data.

Closes #104035
Closes #104038

pull_requests.title: [ML] Detect timeout when waiting for download task (#103197)
pull_requests.author: davidkyle

commits.message:
[ML] Detect timeout when waiting for download task (#103197)

A list tasks timeout indicates the task exists and is in progress.
Interpreting the timeout as the task not existing meant the download
check would incorrectly assume the download had completed.
# Conflicts:
#	x-pack/plugin/ml-package-loader/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/xpack/ml/packageloader/action/TransportLoadTrainedModelPackage.java
#	x-pack/plugin/src/yamlRestTest/resources/rest-api-spec/test/ml/3rd_party_deployment.yml

pull_requests.body:
A list tasks timeout indicates the task exists and is in progress. Interpreting the timeout as the task not existing meant the download check would incorrectly assume the download had completed.

backport of #103197

pull_requests.title: Account for shard count in profiling test timeout
pull_requests.author: danielmitterdorfer

commits.message:
Account for shard count in profiling test timeout

With this commit we increase the timeout to wait for a green cluster
state in the integration tests for the profiling plugin. We do this
because the tests create all profiling-related indices with more shards
than usual and that might take longer than usual until the cluster is
green.

Closes #103809

pull_requests.body:
With this commit we increase the timeout to wait for a green cluster state in the integration tests for the profiling plugin. We do this because the tests create all profiling-related indices with more shards than usual and that might take longer than usual until the cluster is green.

Closes #103809

pull_requests.title: ESQL: Run async tests more carefully
pull_requests.author: nik9000

commits.message:
ESQL: Run async tests more carefully

The ESQL async tests run the ESQL yaml tests two extra time - once under
the async endpoint with the `wait_for_completion_timeout` set to a long
time and *again* with `wait_for_completion_timeout` set to a short time,
expecting to receive an `id` for the query.

That second way is tricky! Even with a `0ms` timeout sometimes the
request will complete. That's great, but the tests didn't realize that
was possible. And it's tricky to get the warnings and `catch` sections
working properly with that. This reworks how we run these commands,
breaking apart the way we run a single API and running it as two, taking
into account that the "start the query" request could also complete the
query.

Closes #104294

pull_requests.body:
The ESQL async tests run the ESQL yaml tests two extra time - once under the async endpoint with the `wait_for_completion_timeout` set to a long time and *again* with `wait_for_completion_timeout` set to a short time, expecting to receive an `id` for the query.

That second way is tricky! Even with a `0ms` timeout sometimes the request will complete. That's great, but the tests didn't realize that was possible. And it's tricky to get the warnings and `catch` sections working properly with that. This reworks how we run these commands, breaking apart the way we run a single API and running it as two, taking into account that the "start the query" request could also complete the query.

Closes #104294

pull_requests.title: Fix: remove wrong assertion from `ESRestTestFeatureService#clusterHasFeature`
pull_requests.author: ldematte

commits.message:
Fix: removed wrong assertion in ESRestTestFeatureService#clusterHasFeature

The check is currently broken - feature check always falls back to historical features, and only then if the feature is not one of the historical ones, and exception (assert) is risen.
This is wrong: it could be that we are testing for a non-historical feature, and the cluster simply does not have it.

The check could be fixed with https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/104257, but we decided it has little advantage over the complexity it brings - better remove it.

pull_requests.body:
The check is currently broken - feature check always falls back to historical features, and only then if the feature is not one of the historical ones, and exception (assert) is risen.
This is wrong: it could be that we are testing for a non-historical feature, and the cluster under test simply does not have it.

The check could be fixed with https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/104257, but we decided it has little advantage over the complexity it brings - better remove it.

pull_requests.title: Add checks for old cluster features in rolling upgrade tests
pull_requests.author: ldematte

commits.message:
Add checks for old cluster features in rolling upgrade tests

Add the ability to test for the original/old cluster features during a rolling upgrade
Merge branch 'old-cluster-features' of github.com:ldematte/elasticsearch into old-cluster-features
Moving ALL_FEATURES to ESRestTestCase (and make it private - only usage)

comments.body: The clear is an `AfterClass`. So should this be `BeforeClass`?

Does it make sense to have this defined here, now the interface is more complicated? It's only used in ESRestTestCase, and the implementation of `getAllSupportedFeatures` references its use. So I think this should instead be the initial instance of `ESRestTestCase.testFeatureService`
That's a good point; I'll move it there.

It cannot be in `BeforeClass`, as it needs `testFeatureService` to be initialized - which for reasons happens in a `Before` method in the base class.
Besides, it follows the same pattern as the other initialization functions in the test, like `extractOldIndexVersion`.
My understanding is that everything is initialized in `Before` (keeping track of the upgrade "phase"), and when only when all tests from all phases are done we cleanup (that's why `AfterClass`)
I was also wondering if I should rename it to something like `UNINITIALIZED`, but decided to leave it as-is for now

pull_requests.body: Add the ability to test for the original/old cluster features during a rolling upgrade

pull_requests.title: Add comma escape character
pull_requests.author: astefan

commits.message: Add escape character for comma in CsvTestsDataLoader
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch into add_comma_escape_csvtestloader
Handle escaped commas in .csv-spec values as well
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch into add_comma_escape_csvtestloader
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch into add_comma_escape_csvtestloader
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch into add_comma_escape_csvtestloader
Merge branch 'main' of https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch into add_comma_escape_csvtestloader

comments.body:
This change comes as a consequence of `main` method not working anymore because of `Exception in thread "main" java.security.AccessControlException: access denied ("org.elasticsearch.secure_sm.ThreadPermission" "modifyArbitraryThreadGroup")`. The `main` doesn't work being executed from within IDE (run from gradle or as a Java class) or outside of it with gradle. The exception comes from randomization code inside Lucene

```
	at org.apache.lucene.tests.util.LuceneTestCase.random(LuceneTestCase.java:800)
	at org.elasticsearch.test.ESTestCase.randomFrom(ESTestCase.java:1003)
	at org.elasticsearch.test.rest.ESRestTestCase.randomSupportedContentType(ESRestTestCase.java:2409)
	at org.elasticsearch.test.rest.ESRestTestCase.addXContentBody(ESRestTestCase.java:2413)
	at org.elasticsearch.test.rest.ESRestTestCase.newXContentRequest(ESRestTestCase.java:2426)
	at org.elasticsearch.test.rest.ESRestTestCase.createIndex(ESRestTestCase.java:1709)
```

pull_requests.body:
Add an escape character for CSV loading.
Change the way indices are created when CsvTestsDataLoader is executed standalone as "main" class.

pull_requests.title: ESQL: Harden async tests
pull_requests.author: nik9000

commits.message:
ESQL: Harden asyn tests

I've seen errors in the async tests where they expect to return an `id`
but the results come back too fast! Well, this forces us to return the
`id` even if we have the results. Then the test can happily fetch by the
`id` every time.

Closes #104251

pull_requests.body:
I've seen errors in the async tests where they expect to return an `id` but the results come back too fast! Well, this forces us to return the `id` even if we have the results. Then the test can happily fetch by the `id` every time.

Closes #104251

pull_requests.title: ESQL: Test all operators with breaker
pull_requests.author: nik9000

commits.message:
ESQL: Test all operators with breaker

This modifies the operator tests to *always* test with a breaker without
the ability to opt out. Previously three operations opted out:
1. mv_expand never through exceptions even though it should. It was
   using the block factory of the test blocks which didn't have a
   breaker. I modified the test blocks to take a breaker so now it
   properly breaks.
2. reading values was throwing strange exceptions when I first wrote
   these tests and I didn't have time to get it work. I don't 100%
   recall what those exceptions were but they seem to be gone now. Good
   fairies?
3. The "project" operator doesn't allocate much of anything - it just
   drops or shifts block around. But the work I did to move the test
   blocks under the limit makes it so the test itself can throw. That's
   good enough for this.

pull_requests.body:
This modifies the operator tests to *always* test with a breaker without the ability to opt out. Previously three operations opted out:
1. mv_expand never through exceptions even though it should. It was using the block factory of the test blocks which didn't have a breaker. I modified the test blocks to take a breaker so now it properly breaks.
2. reading values was throwing strange exceptions when I first wrote these tests and I didn't have time to get it work. I don't 100% recall what those exceptions were but they seem to be gone now. Good fairies?
3. The "project" operator doesn't allocate much of anything - it just drops or shifts block around. But the work I did to move the test blocks under the limit makes it so the test itself can throw. That's good enough for this.

pull_requests.title: Encapsulate recoverLocallyUpToGlobalCheckpoint in tests
pull_requests.author: DaveCTurner

commits.message:
Encapsulate recoverLocallyUpToGlobalCheckpoint in tests

We call `IndexShard#recoverLocallyUpToGlobalCheckpoint` in a synchronous
way in various tests. This commit encapsulates all these calls in a
utility method so that we can adapt it into an async API without masses
of noise.

pull_requests.body:
We call `IndexShard#recoverLocallyUpToGlobalCheckpoint` in a synchronous
way in various tests. This commit encapsulates all these calls in a
utility method so that we can adapt it into an async API without masses
of noise.

pull_requests.title: Add names of "regular" cluster features to extracted feature metadata
pull_requests.author: ldematte

commits.message:
Add regular feature names to feature metadata extraction.

Plus, fix logic to detect if a feature is "off" or "non-existing" (wrong, non-existing id). This works only for non-legacy tests, otherwise we log a warning and skip the check.

comments.body: Can use `File.pathSeparator` instead
Shouldn't be checking against concrete types - should be `Collection<?>` instead
Use `Comparator.naturalOrder()` again
Using concrete type again
Do we need to catch & hide IOException here? Can't it just propagate?
Why a biconsumer here? Why not return `Tuple<Map<,>, Set<>>`?
I don't like tuples, they are too "opaque" - they make it difficult to tell what is what and to see types

pull_requests.body:
Today we extract all historical features to a JSON map that is parsed by ESRestTestCase to provide info about historical features. 
This PR adds to that map the list of all names (Ids) of regular features too, so we can reliably raise an error if a feature is not defined.

The logic we have today to detect if a feature is "off" or "non-existing" (wrong, non-existing id) is flawed and works only for historical features. This fixes it. The distinction works only for non-legacy tests; for legacy tests, we log a warning and skip the check.

pull_requests.title: [ML] Unmute MLModelDeploymentsUpgradeIT testTrainedModelDeployment
pull_requests.author: droberts195

commits.message:
[ML] Do not cache ml-cpp dependencies locally

When all the ml-cpp files were in one zip file it was possible
to cache locally for a while. Now that they are split between
two files this can cause hard-to-debug problems, if one file
is cached and the other isn't and this happens at a time when
changes have been made that need to be consistent between both
files. (Such situations are very rare, which is why this problem
hasn't been seen before.)

Fixes #104193

pull_requests.body:
It seems that this test failure was purely down to inconsistency of ml-cpp dependencies, and not a real problem. Therefore the test can be unmuted.

Fixes #104193

pull_requests.title: Remove incorrect is-not-empty asserts in EsqlAsyncActionIT
pull_requests.author: ChrisHegarty

commits.message: Remove incorrect is_no_empty asserts in EsqlAsyncActionIT

pull_requests.body:
This commit removes a couple of incorrect is-not-empty asserts in EsqlAsyncActionIT. 

The original intent of the asserts here was to try to ensure that the completed results are valid - there should be a result. However, there are some test scenarios where an empty list of columns and values is actually the expected and correct result. The asserts are not need, not correct, and should just be removed. The results will be asserted by the caller when the response is returned.

closes #104214

pull_requests.title: ESQL: Allow custom delimiters in CsvTestsDataLoader
pull_requests.author: iverase
pull_requests.body: It is currently not possible to generate datasets if any of the fields contain a comma. To avoid this limitation we can allow each dataset to define its own delimiter so they can overcome this limitation.

pull_requests.title: Find break limits for DocBlock tests on fly
pull_requests.author: dnhatn

commits.message: Find break limits for DocBlock tests on fly

comments.body: I don't think we need the MAX limit test if we're going to find this on the fly. The act of finding it confirms that it breaks.
I'd move this to the tests that need them. If the build process doesn't properly release on failure this could leave behind un-released blocks. Better to have that fail in the test, i think.

pull_requests.body:
The test failure is related to #104159, where we had an overestimate of the RAM usage for X-ArrayVector. Instead of updating the break limits, this PR uses the breaker utility that @nik9000  wrote to dynamically compute the limits on-the-fly.

Closes #104191

pull_requests.title: ESQL: Fix bug in topn tests
pull_requests.author: nik9000

commits.message:
ESQL: Fix bug in topn tests

This fixes a bug in the topn tests which failed because we tried to sort
of a geo field. Geo fields aren't valid sort keys but the test is
randomized and rarely picks them. This stops it from picking them.

comments.body: I added all of this to make debugging eaier.
And this is the real fix.

pull_requests.body:
This fixes a bug in the topn tests which failed because we tried to sort of a geo field. Geo fields aren't valid sort keys but the test is randomized and rarely picks them. This stops it from picking them.

Most of the text of this change is actually just me making debugging easier.

Closes #104167

pull_requests.title: ESQL: Run yaml tests async
pull_requests.author: nik9000

commits.message:
ESQL: Run yaml tests async

This adds tests that run the our suite of yaml tests against the ESQL
async endpoint. That's quite nice because the yaml tests are where we
handle lots of fun error cases and this'll make sure async does sensible
things in those cases.

pull_requests.body: This adds tests that run the our suite of yaml tests against the ESQL async endpoint. That's quite nice because the yaml tests are where we handle lots of fun error cases and this'll make sure async does sensible things in those cases.

pull_requests.body:
Fixes https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/issues/104152

The introduction of more strict checks on using subfields to load the exact value of a TEXT field - mostly for ES|QL - (ie. not loading data from subfields when they don't have the exact same value as the parent field, eg. because of `ignore_above`) triggered some errors in this test.

pull_requests.title: Reduce concurrency of execution for x-pack full cluster restart tests
pull_requests.author: mark-vieira

commits.message: Reduce concurrency of execution for x-pack full cluster restart tests

pull_requests.body: This suite has a number of tests, each spins up a 2 node cluster, and we often see timeouts here. This is likely due to resource contention of too many parallel nodes running. Let's just reduce the concurrency here until we have a better solution for shared clusters in upgrade tests. This is going to extend test execution but should improve stability.

pull_requests.title: Relax incorrect assertion in SnapshotShutdownIT
pull_requests.author: DaveCTurner

commits.message:
Relax incorrect assertion in SnapshotShutdownIT

It's (just about) possible for the data node to apply the initial
snapshot state, start on the first shard snapshot, and hit the IO block,
before the master even applies this cluster state, so we cannot assert
that the snapshot has started when creating the snapshot-paused
listener. This commit fixes the problem by retrying when encountering
that state.

Relates #101717

pull_requests.body:
It's (just about) possible for the data node to apply the initial
snapshot state, start on the first shard snapshot, and hit the IO block,
before the master even applies this cluster state, so we cannot assert
that the snapshot has started when creating the snapshot-paused
listener. This commit fixes the problem by retrying when encountering
that state.

Relates #101717

commits.message: Wait for async actions in AsyncOperator tests

pull_requests.body:
We must wait for the async lookups in AsyncOperator to complete before ending the test to ensure that all blocks are released.

Closes #104130

pull_requests.title: YAML test framework: separate `skip` and `requires` sections
pull_requests.author: ldematte

commits.message: Introduce SkipVersionContext and consolidate skip() methods
Intermediate step: moved section construction to a builder

Introduce SkipCriteria for modular skip decisions

- Refined SkipSectionContext to uniform boolean tests on the cluster properties
- Removed accessors to specific criteria from SkipSection (used only on tests), adjusted test assertions
- Version range checks commented out, as they have been already addressed in a pending PR (#103311)

Refactoring tests

- moving and adding VersionRange tests
- adding specific version and os skip tests
- modified parse/validate/build to make SkipSection more unit-testable

Simplify

- Remove SkipSectionContext
- Replace SkipCriteria interface with Predicate + factory
- Moved Features check (YAML test runner features) to SkipSection build time

Separated check for xpack/no_xpack

Check for xpack is cluster-configuration (modules installed) dependent, while Features are meant to be "static" test-runner capabilities. We separate them so checks on one (test-runner features) can be run before and separately from the other.
Fix Version/Strings nodeVersions mismatch after merge

Addressing comments

- removed not-so-helpful toString for Version SkipCriteria
- renaming
- removed un-needed file
Divide requires and skip parsing (distinct sections)

comments.body:
Very optional nit, feel free to ignore, for consistency these could be:
- `[forbidden|skipped]Version`
- `[forbidden|skipped]OperatingSystems`
- `[forbidden|skipped]ClusterFeatures`
nit, maybe `yamlRunnerRequiresFeature` is easier to understand?
Should this be renamed? `hasYamlRunnerFeature` or similar
Should we log a warning here and let people know how to migrate?
Same as above, log a warning?
require`s`Criteria vs requireCriteria, not sure if that is intended
Just a thought, how about appending that to the `requiresReason` in the builder when required runner features are missing?
For consistency with `ClientYamlTestSuite`, I have renamed all as `hasYamlRunnerFeature`
Added
It's a good idea, but I prefer to leave it as is for now, so the output message does not change too much.

pull_requests.body:
This PR introduces a new `requires` field in parallel to the existing `skip` field; after trying out more elaborate alternatives, I choose to keep the change minimal wrt https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/pull/103909 and previous refactoring. Since renaming `SkipSection` to `PrerequisiteSection` (as it was strange to keep the name "Skip" when it contains both `skip` and `requires`) is making things muddier, this is what changed:
- parseIfNext/parseInternal is now "detecting" both `skip` and `requires` (in any order)
- parseInternal is split into (acutally, delegates) parseSkipSection and parseRequiresSection
- parseSkipSection and parseRequiresSection are the same as before -- except each accepts and parses a sub-selection of fields.
- the builder introduced previously is the same, and it is shared by parseSkipSection and parseRequiresSection; this keeps the change minimal but also make cross-field validation easier.

In a first iteration, I think about keeping `skip: features: ...` so we do not have to mix a monster change with this PR; I have added `requires: test_runner_features: ...` in parallel. We can migrate tests to that separately.

See `PrerequisiteSectionTests` for how it looks like. An example: 

```
requires:
   test_runner_features:  some-runner feature
   cluster_features:      needed-feature
   reason:                test needs needed-feature to run
skip:
   cluster_features:      undesired-feature
   reason:                test cannot run when undesired-feature are present
```

pull_requests.title: ESQL: Update some QA suites to allow running in Serverless
pull_requests.author: bpintea

commits.message:
Update some QA suites to run in Serverless

This applies the changes needed to have single-node and heap-atack
suites run in Serverless.

comments.body:
Setting node count isn't supported in Serverless.
Considering that `1` is the default, I think the easiest is to just remove the setting. This would be preferred IMO to "detecting" the environment.

pull_requests.body: This applies the changes needed to have `single-node` and `heap-atack` suites run in Serverless.

pull_requests.author: martijnvg
pull_requests.body:

pull_requests.title: [Test] Disable rare actions in RepoAnalysisFailureIT
pull_requests.author: ywangd

commits.message:
[Test] More robust disruption for blob read

When it is time to interupt and the actual content is null, we now send
back a random byte instead of null so that the disruption happens at all
time.

Resolves: #103791

Revert "[Test] More robust disruption for blob read"

This reverts commit 1791217d8d3762bba5d23f3b8c0ed1e5ea5f2a1f.

[CI] Disable rare actions in RepoAnalysisFailureIT

Rare actions are disabled to improve CI stability.

Resolves: #104109

comments.body: I did not reproduce the failure so that this is a best-effort attempt to fix. It seems plausible that in edge cases the `countDown` may not reach to 0 (hence no disruption) if there are many null `actualContents` or it happens towards the end of total read requests.
I think it is worth moving to a dedicated assertion prior this one.
Why `actualContents` might be null? Also can it be 0 length?

I just noticed it can be `null` but I am actually not sure why. I guess it might related to early read (read before write completes)? @DaveCTurner could you please help out here?

I don't think length can be `0`. Otherwise we will see assertion error from `randomLongBetween(0, length - 1)`.

I thought about that. But it is not possible to assert `countDown` without excuting the analysis. But once the analysis is executed we need to check the error it throws first. So there is an order issue.
I think this is no longer needed because rare action is disabled. I left it untouched in case it might be more informational (it might be disabled for different reasons?)
Could you make this more specific than just "CI instability", describing how overwrites causes the test failure? I don't think early-reads will be an issue here?

IIUC, early-reads are the reason why we consider checksums of both "write" and "overwrite" contents to be correct. This lieniency is what allows the issue to happen. Normal reads should always return the "overwrite" content and not having this issue. I expanded the comment as suggested. Please let me know if it reads right to you. Thanks!

Ah not quite, the overwrite happens in the "read phase", reads that are concurrent with the overwrite do not count as early:

https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/3031595d6a234c31abe9f7da74a86a72d30d0652/x-pack/plugin/snapshot-repo-test-kit/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/repositories/blobstore/testkit/BlobAnalyzeAction.java#L106-L117

I could some help to understand the code. I don't quite get how Read phase starts before Overwrite. Is this the relevant code?

https://github.com/elastic/elasticsearch/blob/3031595d6a234c31abe9f7da74a86a72d30d0652/x-pack/plugin/snapshot-repo-test-kit/src/main/java/org/elasticsearch/repositories/blobstore/testkit/BlobAnalyzeAction.java#L282-L286

It seems to me that Ovewrite starts first with `writeRandomBlob` and the Read starts right before the last byte of the new content is written?
That sounds about right, but this isn't an early read.

OK I think I understand your point now. This regular read can also possibly return the old content because the overwrite is still ongoing and may not complete before the read returns. So yeah, this read also needs the lenient checksum comparison. I have adjusted the comment accordingly.
Yep that's right LGTM

pull_requests.body:
Rare actions are disabled to improve CI stability.

Resolves: #103791
